CONJUGATES: guests (n. pl.) | guest (v. base) | guests (v. 3rd p. sing.) | guesting (v. present part.) | guested (v. past tense/part.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English *ġiest* (later *gæst*), from Proto-Germanic *gastiz* ('guest, stranger'). Ultimately related to the concept of hospitality.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who is invited to visit, stay in, or be entertained at another's home, club, or workplace.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We have two guests arriving this afternoon who will be staying the week.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们今天下午有两位客人要来，他们会住一周。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A performer, speaker, or celebrity who is invited to appear temporarily on a show, broadcast, or stage.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 特邀嘉宾；客座演员/讲师。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The talk show featured a famous politician as its special guest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个脱口秀请了一位著名政治家作为特邀嘉宾。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Intransitive Verb: action performed without a direct object
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To appear or perform as a guest, often on a television or radio program.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She will be guesting on the late-night panel next Friday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她将于下周五在深夜座谈节目中客串嘉宾。
